ygData.subject: Re: Alchemy tips
ygData.msgSnippet: ... recently by ... can get ... exception of ... a ... the ... best and ... to 23 ... will be ... 44 kitty. ... stuff? I m ... Great Divide ... Oh man, I
ygData.messageBody:
--- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, edward001b <edward001b@...> wrote:
>
> At 11:29 AM 12/3/2006 -0500, you wrote:
>
> >My husband plays a Shammy and he Grandmastered his alchemy
recently by
> >doing just the recipes for the Clarity X potions. He says you
can get
> >everything you need on potion merchants pretty cheap with the
exception of
> >nodding blue lilies which you can either buy in bazaar, forage on
a
> >character that has forage ability or go to Old Sebilis and kill
the
> >froggies for them, fairly good drop rate there and probably your
best and
> >cheapest bet for getting them. Hope that helps. :)
> >
> >Silverminx
> >74 Druid ~ Bristlebane Server
>
> Thank you. I was at 21 in alchemy a few hours ago. I brought it up
to 23
> making Distillate of Alacrity I. I have a long way to go before it
will be
> worth the expense in failures to do a Clarity X. I'm just a level
44 kitty.
>
> Do you bring the points up faster if you mix the more advanced
stuff? I'm
> just asking because I really don't know.
>
> I got two shawls doing Great Divide quests. The giants in the
Great Divide
> don't like me anymore. G.
>
> Edward Fox
>
Oh man, I remember the shawl quest. I was lucky to have gotten the
3rd and 4th shawls before they changed the way things worked with
finding the little dwarf in the snow instead of triggering the death
squad. I managed to get the 8th shawl after two years of raising my
skills. Sadly by that time, the stats weren't really worth the
effort anymore. But I still wore it. If Sony hadn't terminated my
account due to their own billing errors I'd probably still be using
it.
luv,
-Su
